alert.note: Alert for Eastland; Stephens (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 10:33PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Eastland and Stephens Counties through 1130 PM CDT... At 1033 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Ibex to near Moran to 7 miles southeast of Eula. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Breckenridge, Eastland, Cisco, Ranger, Rising Star, Hubbard Creek Reservoir, Lake Cisco, Lake Daniel, Lake Leon, Gunsight, Necessity, Lake Olden, Caddo, Crystal Falls, Pleasant Hill, Carbon, Staff, Nimrod, Kokomo and Sabanno. This includes Interstate 20 between mile markers 324 and 352. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for north central Texas.
